title: CognitiveFinalityContract.v0
description: Defines replay-court-admissible cognition: what a cognitive state is, what a decision is, and when finality may be declared.

arc_id.description: Worldline identifier this contract binds to (ArcState).

state_model.description: Definition of a valid cognitive state.

state_space.description: Reference to the state representation (e.g., phase-space, tensor, graph).

invariants.description: Conditions that must hold for any state to be considered valid.

decision_model.description: Definition of what constitutes a decision.

transition_type.description: How decisions are represented in the state model.

required_evidence.description: Evidence that must exist for a decision to be replay-admissible.

logging_requirements.description: What must be logged for replay-court admissibility.

event_schema.description: Reference to the event schema used for cognitive logs (e.g., AgentEvent.v1).

minimum_fields.description: Fields that must be present in every logged decision event.

finality_conditions.description: When a cognitive process is allowed to declare finality.

allowed_states.description: State labels from which finality may be declared.

required_checks.description: Checks that must pass before finality is valid (e.g., invariants_satisfied, drift_absent).

drift_detection.description: How cognitive drift is detected before it becomes hallucination.

thresholds.description: Named thresholds for drift metrics (e.g., max_divergence, max_entropy_delta).

actions.description: Actions to take when drift is detected (e.g., abort, quarantine, require_human_review).
